item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18697)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “'It was a true partnership with progressives and...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“'It was a true partnership with progressives and activists alongside conservatives and places like the Cato Institute,' the libertarian think tank, she said. 'That partnership really made the qualified immunity provision a very solid part of the bill.'”- State Representative Leslie Herod

Tampa Bay Times

The legal doctrine makes it nearly impossible to sue individual officers in abuse cases. A proposed bill would change that, but faces an uphill battle in the legislature.

tampabay.com

Could Florida end qualified immunity, which gives cops ‘absolute shield’ in lawsuits?

The legal doctrine makes it nearly impossible to sue individual officers in abuse cases. A proposed bill would change that, but faces an uphill battle in the legislature.The legal doctrine makes it nearly impossible to sue individual officers in abuse cases. A proposed bill would change that, but faces an uphill battle in the legislature.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "No. It's about a cycle of substance use, of mental...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"No. It's about a cycle of substance use, of mental health crisis, of inappropriate law enforcement response and an inappropriate criminal justice response." - State Representative Leslie Herod

WBUR 90.9 FM
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: @e are live with Governor Jared Polis to unveil the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

@e are live with Governor Jared Polis to unveil the stimulus package!

Governor Jared Polis was live.

Today I’m joining legislative leadership and business owners to unveil our bold stimulus package! These one-time strategic investments will help Coloradans get ...back to work and not only make critical investment in our infrastructure and workforce today, but keep us moving forward together for years to come.

See More
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Menstruation products are not luxury goods. The state should...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Menstruation products are not luxury goods. The state should do everything in its power to fight against period poverty." - State Representative Leslie Herod

The Denver Post

Aurora’s ordinance stipulates that tampons, panty liners, menstrual cups and sanitary napkins would be exempt from the city’s 3.75% sales tax, though state sales tax and other taxes levied at the p…

denverpost.com

Aurora takes first step to stop taxing menstrual products

Aurora’s ordinance stipulates that tampons, panty liners, menstrual cups and sanitary napkins would be exempt from the city’s 3.75% sales tax, though state sales tax and other taxes levied at the p…Aurora’s ordinance stipulates that tampons, panty liners, menstrual cups and sanitary napkins would be exempt from the city’s 3.75% sales tax, though state sales tax and other taxes levied at the p…
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "No one should be penalized for the way their hair grows...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"No one should be penalized for the way their hair grows naturally out of their heads. We should support and celebrate our diversity, and we should ensure that Colorado is in place to protect folks who are being discriminated against.” -State Representative Leslie Herod

Global Citizen

A timeline of when Connecticut, Virginia, Colorado, Washington, New Jersey, New York, Colorado passed hair discrimination laws.

globalcitizen.org

8 States Across the US That Have Banned Black Hair Discrimination

A timeline of when Connecticut, Virginia, Colorado, Washington, New Jersey, New York, Colorado passed hair discrimination laws.A timeline of when Connecticut, Virginia, Colorado, Washington, New Jersey, New York, Colorado passed hair discrimination laws.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “It’s the smallest things, can make the biggest impact,”...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“It’s the smallest things, can make the biggest impact,” said state Sen. James Coleman, a Denver Democrat who is a prime sponsor of the legislation. “That piece of plastic is elusive or impossible for formerly incarcerated folks to secure.”

The Colorado Sun

It can be the key to accessing social services and education opportunities, getting a job or finding a place to live. But as recently as 2015, fewer than half of the adults leaving Colorado’s prison system had a state-issued photo identification card or driver’s license when they were released. ...

coloradosun.com

Colorado could soon be required to help every person leaving prison get a photo ID

It can be the key to accessing social services and education opportunities, getting a job or finding a place to live. But as recently as 2015, fewer than half of the adults leaving Colorado’s prison system had a state-issued photo identification card or driver’s license when they were released. ...It can be the key to accessing social services and education opportunities, getting a job or finding a place to live. But as recently as 2015, fewer than half of the adults leaving Colorado’s prison system had a state-issued photo identification card or driver’s license when they were released. ...

item.title: “The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.”

9NEWS (KUSA)

The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.

9news.com

11-year-old boy with autism handcuffed at school, mom sues district, sheriff's office

The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "We should follow CDC guidelines and focus on vaccinating...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"We should follow CDC guidelines and focus on vaccinating inmates at the same time with corrections officers. We are creating unsafe situations, untenable situations not only for inmates but also for those who work in the prison system. An equitable COVID response includes vaccinating inmates as soon as we can."

Colorado Politics

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, inmates should be vaccinated right along with corrections workers to cap community spread.

coloradopolitics.com

As South African COVID variant appears in Colorado, issue of vaccinating inmates rises again

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, inmates should be vaccinated right along with corrections workers to cap community spread.According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, inmates should be vaccinated right along with corrections workers to cap community spread.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "This is funding that goes directly to our local...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"This is funding that goes directly to our local communities. It is for us to make sure that folks are getting back to work and stimulating the economy.”

Colorado Politics

The bill, part of a package of supplemental spending measures that cleared the House on Friday, puts general fund dollars into a CDOT program developed in the wake of the

coloradopolitics.com

General Assembly approves $30 million for CDOT's Revitalizing Main Streets program

The bill, part of a package of supplemental spending measures that cleared the House on Friday, puts general fund dollars into a CDOT program developed in the wake of theThe bill, part of a package of supplemental spending measures that cleared the House on Friday, puts general fund dollars into a CDOT program developed in the wake of the
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Because we have historically left people out of the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Because we have historically left people out of the conversation and the industry, and then changed our mind as Colorado and said, 'Wait — you can enter the industry now,' we have created a marketplace where people can't enter in, especially if they don't have the same connections and investors as some of our other counterparts, especially social equity partners," - State Representative Leslie Herod

Denver Business Journal

The fund will be administered by OEDIT, and used to help entrepreneurs historically and systematically blocked from the burgeoning and booming cannabis industry.

bizjournals.com

$4M fund for social-equity cannabis entrepreneurs passes Colorado Legislature - Denver Business Journal

The fund will be administered by OEDIT, and used to help entrepreneurs historically and systematically blocked from the burgeoning and booming cannabis industry.The fund will be administered by OEDIT, and used to help entrepreneurs historically and systematically blocked from the burgeoning and booming cannabis industry.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "The strength of the women in my family has been a driving...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The strength of the women in my family has been a driving force in my life. I was searching for an idea that would include the arts [and] that would support women somehow.”

5280 Magazine

Through her AZ Foundation, Carrie MaKenna is on a mission to seek out and install artwork that represents the achievements of Colorado women.

5280.com

Where’s All the Public Artwork Honoring Colorado Women? - 5280

Through her AZ Foundation, Carrie MaKenna is on a mission to seek out and install artwork that represents the achievements of Colorado women.Through her AZ Foundation, Carrie MaKenna is on a mission to seek out and install artwork that represents the achievements of Colorado women.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "President Joe Biden will sign two executive orders Monday...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"President Joe Biden will sign two executive orders Monday to ensure his administration keeps its promise to promote gender equality, including an order to evaluate the current policy guidelines for Title IX, the federal civil rights law that upholds gender equity in education. "

HuffPost

The president will also sign an executive order establishing a Gender Policy Council within the executive office.

huffpost.com

Biden To Sign Executive Order Reviewing Betsy DeVos’ Title IX Rules

The president will also sign an executive order establishing a Gender Policy Council within the executive office.The president will also sign an executive order establishing a Gender Policy Council within the executive office.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Indigenous students with historical ties to Colorado could...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Indigenous students with historical ties to Colorado could soon get in-state tuition at public colleges under a proposal that recently cleared its first legislative hurdle."

The Colorado Sun

By Jason Gonzales, Chalkbeat Colorado Indigenous students with historical ties to Colorado could soon get in-state tuition at public colleges under a proposal that recently cleared its first legislative hurdle. Student advocates say the bill is part of a broader push on how Colorado schools need to....

coloradosun.com

Indigenous students say they need more from Colorado universities. An in-state tuition bill is a first step.

By Jason Gonzales, Chalkbeat Colorado Indigenous students with historical ties to Colorado could soon get in-state tuition at public colleges under a proposal that recently cleared its first legislative hurdle. Student advocates say the bill is part of a broader push on how Colorado schools need to....By Jason Gonzales, Chalkbeat Colorado Indigenous students with historical ties to Colorado could soon get in-state tuition at public colleges under a proposal that recently cleared its first legislative hurdle. Student advocates say the bill is part of a broader push on how Colorado schools need to....
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "'Stronger,' in their view, means a more...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"'Stronger,' in their view, means a more resilient and prosperous Colorado for all. But vulnerable people and their advocates find that slogan rings a bit hollow — that it’s hard to look ahead considering Colorado’s long-simmering inequalities in pay, employment, housing and hunger have expanded. Pick nearly any indicator, and it will show Colorado has become a less equal place."

The Denver Post

Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.

denverpost.com

As job, housing and pay inequalities worsen, Coloradans say mantra to “build back stronger” rings hollow

Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.Food aid and state-funded diapers are easy temporary fixes. But addressing the root causes of poverty and inequality is another, much tougher matter.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “The more-contagious COVID-19 variant first identified in...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The more-contagious COVID-19 variant first identified in South Africa has been confirmed in Colorado for the first time, with three cases detected in a Chaffee County prison that’s experiencing its third coronavirus outbreak, state health officials announced Sunday night.”

The more-contagious COVID-19 variant first identified in South Africa has been confirmed in Colorado for the first time, with three cases detected in a Chaffee County prison that’s experienci…

denverpost.com

South African COVID-19 variant confirmed in Colorado for first time

The more-contagious COVID-19 variant first identified in South Africa has been confirmed in Colorado for the first time, with three cases detected in a Chaffee County prison that’s experienci…The more-contagious COVID-19 variant first identified in South Africa has been confirmed in Colorado for the first time, with three cases detected in a Chaffee County prison that’s experienci…

item.title: "House lawmakers on Wednesday passed the George Floyd...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"House lawmakers on Wednesday passed the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act, a reform bill that would ban chokeholds and alter so-called qualified immunity for law enforcement, which would make it easier to pursue claims of police misconduct."

NPR

The bill, which would ban chokeholds and eliminate qualified immunity for law enforcement, now advances to the Senate.

npr.org

House Approves Police Reform Bill Named After George Floyd

The bill, which would ban chokeholds and eliminate qualified immunity for law enforcement, now advances to the Senate.The bill, which would ban chokeholds and eliminate qualified immunity for law enforcement, now advances to the Senate.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "President Joe Biden has come through with his promise to...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"President Joe Biden has come through with his promise to promote inclusion by appointing Reggie Greer as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues"

PinkNews

Former Victory Institute staffer Reggie Greer has officially joined president Joe Biden’s administration as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues.

pinknews.co.uk

Joe Biden stays true to his word by appointing senior advisor on LGBT+ issues

Former Victory Institute staffer Reggie Greer has officially joined president Joe Biden’s administration as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues.Former Victory Institute staffer Reggie Greer has officially joined president Joe Biden’s administration as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues.

item.title: "The Museum of Contemporary Art Denver just announced it...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The Museum of Contemporary Art Denver just announced it will be rebooting live music with a three-part "Garageband" series showcasing local acts."

Denver Westword

Celebrate local music at the MCA.

westword.com

MCA Denver Launches Garageband Concert Series

Celebrate local music at the MCA.Celebrate local music at the MCA.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.

5280.com

State Representative Leslie Herod Has a Story to Share | 5280

Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.
